sen.j: 平 永衡（たいら の ながひら、生年不詳 - 天喜4年（1056年）頃）は、平安時代後期の陸奥国伊具郡の豪族で、伊具十郎と称した。
sen.e: TAIRA no Nagahira (year of birth unknown - around 1056) is a local ruling family of Igu county, Mutsu province and he called himself Juro Igu.
TAIRA no Nagahira (year of birth unknown - around 1056) was from a local ruling family in Igu county, Mutsu province and he called himself Juro Igu.
sen.cmt: 個人が主語なので「豪族」の出、というように考えて、左記のように変えました。
sen.e: TAIRA no Nagahira (year of birth unknown - around 1056) was from a local ruling family in Igu county, Mutsu province and he called himself Juro Igu.

sen.j: 郡司であったとも在庁官人として陸奥国府多賀城に勤務していたとも言われる。
sen.e: He is said to have worked at Taga Jyo Castle in Mutsu province as a Zaichokanjin though he was a gunji (district manager).
He is said to have worked at Taga-jo Castle in Mutsu province as a Zaichokanjin (a local official in Heian and Kamakura periods) though he was a gunji (district manager).
sen.cmt: 在庁官人の説明を加えました。
sen.e: He is said to have worked at Taga-jo Castle in Mutsu province as a Zaichokanjin (a local official in Heian and Kamakura periods) though he was a gunji (district manager).

sen.j: 父は不明だが、下総国の平氏の一族とする系図があり、海道平氏、岩城氏と繋がる家系であったとする意見がある。
sen.e: His father is unknown but there is a family tree that says he was a family of the Taira clan in Shimousa province and that he was in the family line of the Kaidou Taira clan, Iwaki-shi.
sen.cmt: 海道平氏の読み方がわかりませんでした。
sen.e: His father is unknown but a family tree exists that shows he was from a family of the Taira clan in Shimousa province and there is a view that he was in the family line of the Kaidou Taira clan (the Iwaki clan).
sen.cmt: that節のつながりがわかりにくかったのでまとめました。
sen.e: His father is unknown but an existing family tree implies that he was from a family of the Taira clan in Shimousa province and there is a view that he was in the family line of the Kaidou Taira clan (the Iwaki clan).

sen.j: 『陸奥話記』にのみ、その名が登場する。
sen.e: His name only appears in "Mutsuwaki."
His name only appears in "Mutsuwaki."
His name only appears in "Mutsuwaki."

sen.j: 藤原経清は相婿、奥州藤原氏の祖である藤原清衡は甥。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Tsunekiyo is his brother-in-law and FUJIWARA no Kiyohira, who is the root of the Oshu-Fujiwara clan, is his nephew.
FUJIWARA no Tsunekiyo was his brother-in-law and FUJIWARA no Kiyohira, who was the root of the Oshu-Fujiwara clan, was his nephew.
sen.cmt: 過去の事実なので過去形にしました。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Tsunekiyo was his brother-in-law and FUJIWARA no Kiyohira, who was the root of the Oshu-Fujiwara clan, was his nephew.

sen.j: はじめ陸奥国守藤原登任に従う。
sen.e: To start with, he obeyed FUJIWARA no Naritou who was Mutsu no kuni no kami (the governor of Mutsu province).
At first, he obeyed FUJIWARA no Naritou, who was Mutsu no kuni no kami (the governor of Mutsu province).
sen.cmt: 先行詞が固有名詞なのでカンマを加え非制限用法の関係詞にしました。
sen.e: At first, he obeyed FUJIWARA no Naritou, who was Mutsu no kuni no kami (the governor of Mutsu province).

sen.j: 1051年（永承6年）頃に鬼切部の戦いで国府と対立していた奥州六郡を支配する俘囚（ふしゅう）長の安倍頼時（頼良）の娘（史料による呼称は「中加一乃末陪」、読み方不明、安倍貞任の妹、経清室の「有加一乃末陪」は姉）を妻に迎える。
sen.e: Around 1051, the daughter of ABE no Yoritoki, (referred to as '中加一乃末陪' in historical sources whose pronunciation is unknown. Sadato ABE's younger sister '有加一乃末陪' of Tsunekiyo shitsu is the older sister) who was the head of the barbarians in control of the six counties in Oshu (Northern Honshu), became his wife.
sen.cmt: 経清室の読み方が不明です。
sen.e: Around 1051, a daughter of ABE no Yoritoki, (in historical sources she was referred to as '中加一乃末陪' [pronounciation unkonwn], and '有加一乃末陪,' Sadato ABE's younger sister and Tsunekiyo's wife, was her older sister) who was the head of the barbarians in control of the six counties in Oshu (Northern Honshu), became his wife.
sen.cmt: 安倍頼時（頼良）の娘（史料による呼称は「中加一乃末陪」、読み方不明、安倍貞任の妹、経清室の「有加一乃末陪」は姉）のくだりをまとめました。
sen.e: Around 1051, a daughter of ABE no Yoritoki, (in historical sources she was referred to as '中加一乃末陪' [pronounciation unkonwn], and '有加一乃末陪,' Sadato ABE's younger sister and Tsunekiyo's wife, was her older sister) who was the head of the barbarians in control of the six counties in Oshu (Northern Honshu), became his wife.

sen.j: 登任の後任に源頼義が任じられ、頼時が朝廷に帰服すると頼義に従う。
sen.e: MINAMOTO no Yoriyoshi was appointed as Naritou's successor and he obeyed Yoriyoshi when he returned to the Imperial Court.
MINAMOTO no Yoriyoshi was appointed as Naritou's successor and he obeyed Yoriyoshi when he returned to the Imperial Court.
MINAMOTO no Yoriyoshi was appointed as Naritou's successor and he obeyed Yoriyoshi when he returned to the Imperial Court.

sen.j: 頼義は安倍頼時を挑発し、1056年（天喜4年）に安倍氏が蜂起し前九年の役と呼ばれる合戦に至る。
sen.e: Yoriyoshi provoked ABE no Yoritoki which led to Abe's uprise to the battle known as the Zenkunen War (the Early Nine Years' War) in 1056.
Yoriyoshi provoked ABE no Yoritoki, which led to Abe's uprise to the battle known as the Zenkunen War (the Early Nine Years' War) in 1056.
sen.cmt: 先行詞が固有名詞なのでカンマを加え非制限用法の関係詞にしました。
sen.e: Yoriyoshi provoked ABE no Yoritoki, which led to Abe's uprise to the battle known as the Zenkunen War (the Early Nine Years' War) in 1056.

sen.j: この時衣川の南にいた平永衡、藤原経清は頼義に従って戦っていたが、二人とも頼時の婿であるからと疑われていた。
sen.e: TAIRA no Nagahira and FUJIWARA no Tsunekiyo, who were in the south of Koromogawa, were fighting in obedience of Yoriyoshi but they were both suspected because they were son-in-laws of Yoshitoki.
TAIRA no Nagahira and FUJIWARA no Tsunekiyo, who were in the south of Koromogawa, were fighting under Yoriyoshi but they were both suspected because they were son-in-laws of Yoshitoki.
sen.cmt: 「頼義に従って」をunderにしました。
sen.e: TAIRA no Nagahira and FUJIWARA no Tsunekiyo, who were in the south of Koromogawa, were fighting under Yoriyoshi but they were both suspected because they were son-in-laws of Yoshitoki.

sen.j: さらにこの時永衡は、陣中できらびやかな銀の冑を着けているので、これは敵軍への通牒でないかと頼義に密告するものがあり、安倍氏への内通を疑われて殺される。
sen.e: Also, Nagahira wore a glittering silver warrior helmet at the time which people squealed to Yoriyoshi that it was a notice to the enemy so he was suspected of betrayal to the Abe clan and later killed.

Also, at that time Nagahira wore a glittering silver warrior helmet, which people squealed to Yoriyoshi that it was a notice to the enemy so he was suspected of betrayal to the Abe clan and later killed.
sen.cmt: whichの先行詞が離れていたので副詞のat that timeを前にもってきて先行詞と関係詞の節をつなげました。
sen.e: Also, at that time Nagahira wore a glittering silver warrior helmet, which people squealed to Yoriyoshi that it was a notice to the enemy so he was suspected of betrayal to the Abe clan and later killed.

sen.j: これが引き金となって経清は安倍氏の陣営に属し、前九年の役が長引く原因となった。
sen.e: This triggered Tsunekiyo to belong to the Abe clan's camp which caused the Zenkunen War (the Early Nine Years' War) to prolong.
This triggered Tsunekiyo to belong to the Abe clan's camp and prolonged the Zenkunen War (the Early Nine Years' War).
This triggered Tsunekiyo to belong to the Abe clan's camp and prolonged the Zenkunen War (the Early Nine Years' War).
